intro: Antheropeas wallacei, commonly known as the Wallace's antheropeas, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
